sentences.sentence: Before the sun had risen, the wife came and woke the two children, saying,
“Get up, lazy children! We are going into the forest to cut wood.”
Then she gave each of them a piece of bread, and said,
“That is for dinner, and you must not eat it before then, for you will get no more.”
Grethel carried the bread, because Hansel had his pockets full of the white pebbles( 鹅卵石 ).
Then they set off all together on their way to the forest.
When they had gone a little way Hansel stood still and looked back toward the house, and this he did again and again, till his father said to him,
“Hansel, what are you looking at? We need to keep walking.”
“Oh father,” said Hansel, “I am looking at my little white kitten( 小猫 ), who is sitting on the roof( 房顶 ) waving( 挥手 ) me goodbye.”
“You young fool( 傻子 ),” said the woman, “that is not your kitten, but the sunshine on the chimney( 烟囱 ).”
Of course Hansel had not been looking at his kitten, but had been dropping pebbles on the road, one by one.
When they had reached the middle of the forest, the father told the children to collect wood to make a fire to keep them warm.
Hansel and Grethel gathered( 收集 ) plenty of( 许多 ) wood, and it was set on fire.
When the flame( 火焰 ) was burning quite high, the wife said,
“Now lie down by the fire and rest, children. We will go and cut wood. When we are finished, we will come and fetch( 接 ) you.”
So Hansel and Grethel sat by the fire, and at noon  they each ate their pieces of bread.
They thought their father was in the wood all the time, since they seemed to hear the sound of the ax( 斧头 );
but really it was only a dry branch( 树枝 ) hanging on a dead tree, moving with the wind and hitting the tree.
So when they had stayed there a long time their eyes closed, and they fell fast asleep( 很快入睡 ) . When at last they woke it was night. Grethel began to cry, and said,
“How shall we ever get out of this wood?”
But Hansel comforted her, saying,
“Wait a little while longer, until the moon rises, and then we can easily find the way home.”
And when the full moon had risen, Hansel took his little sister by the hand, and followed the trail( 踪迹 ) of white pebbles that shone like silver, and showed them the road.
They walked on the whole night through, and at sunrise( 日出时分 ) they came to their father’s house and knocked on the door.
When the wife opened it and saw that it was Hansel and Grethel, she said,
“You naughty( 顽皮的 ) children, why did you sleep so long in the wood? We thought you were never coming home again!”
But the father was glad, for he felt terrible about having left them both in the woods alone.
Not very long after that there was again great hunger in that part of the country, and the children heard their mother say at night in bed to their father,
“Our food is gone; all we have left is half a loaf( 一条 ) of bread. We must get rid of( 摆脱掉 )  the children.
We will take them farther into the wood this time, so that they will not be able to find the way back again. There is no other way for us to survive( 存活 ).”
The man felt sad at heart, and he thought,
“It would be better to share one’s last mouthful of food with one’s children.”
But the wife would not listen to him, and insisted( 坚持 ). When a man has given in( 屈服 )  once, he has to do it a second time.
But the children were not asleep, and had heard all the talk.
When the parents had gone to sleep Hansel got up to go out to get more pebbles, as he did before.
But this time the wife had locked the door, and Hansel could not get out. Still, he comforted his little sister, and said,
“Don’t cry, Grethel. Go to sleep quietly. God will help us.”
Early the next morning the wife came and pulled the children out of bed.
She gave them each a little piece of bread—less than before.
On the way to the wood Hansel crumbled( 碾碎 ) the bread in his pocket, and often stopped to throw a crumb of( 少许 )  bread on the ground.
“Hansel, what are you stopping behind and staring( 盯着看 ) for?” said the father.
“I am looking at my little pigeon( 鸽子 ) sitting on the roof( 房顶 ), saying goodbye to me,” answered Hansel.
“You fool,” said the wife, “that is no pigeon. It is just the morning sun, shining on the roof.”
Hansel went on as before, and dropped bread crumbs( 碎屑 ) all along the way.

article_info.previous: 狡猾的大灰狼吃掉外婆和小红帽后睡着了，巨大的鼾声引起了猎人的注意。机敏的猎人救出了外婆和小红帽，狡猾的大灰狼也被杀死了。紧接着是一对兄妹和恶毒的继母斗智斗勇的故事。
article_info.share_words: When they had reached the middle of the forest, the father told the children to collect wood to make a fire to keep them warm.

question.en: Why did Grethel carry the bread?

options.cn: 因为Hansel的口袋装满了白色的鹅卵石。
options.en: Because Hansel had his pockets full of white pebbles.

analysis: 文中提到：“Grethel carried the bread, because Hansel had his pockets full of the white pebbles.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 这个妻子是什么样的人？
question.en: What kind of person was the wife?

analysis: 由原文可知当两兄妹回到家时，这个妻子对他们说：“You naughty children, why did you sleep so long in the wood? We thought you were never coming home again!”从这里可以看出妻子假惺惺地责备两兄妹，是个很虚伪的人，而出主意扔掉两兄妹这件事又可以说明她的恶毒，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当妻子再次要求把孩子们丢弃的时候，他们的父亲是何感受？
question.en: How did the father feel when his wife asked him to abandon his children again?

analysis: 文中提到当恶毒的妻子再次要求丈夫把孩子们丢到森林里时，孩子们的父亲的反应是“The man felt sad at heart.”因此答案选A。
